positive.review: the most concistent gatcha free to play i've ever found he was there before it was a huge thing and it's actually hard but also have easy content, you actually have to strategise, make build of your own or copy other people but  even if you copy you gotta understand why...the game added manny tutorial to make the early game and give acces to the end game to any player very straight fforward just following the guide then you'll be a point where you can do anything well start preparing farming or looking for stuff you like, the premium currency is super generous honestly that game is so good mechanically that i wish we just had a game like this solo with a solo story and full blow rpg adventure tbh, it's very solid. Even with shitty monster you can make them strong find good team by surprise or accident et get attached to most monster.

Pros: Nice casual game, has frequent updates, gives generous rewards, and the art team consistently does a great job with the characters and animations.
Cons: Gacha has no pity, violent runes are still broken.

Overall: Good game to come back to occasionally, no need to spend unless you want to get into its PVP competitively.

The game is nice and is f2p friendly, but is annoying that u can't skip that f story. Most of the time at the beginning you have to wait for the dialogues to end... why there is not a skip button there yet? And why if u want to change the region u have to do it from the account settings after u enter the game? why u can't change it before connected? i switch by mistake to other region and i had to do the hole f story again (without skip buttons of course), spend a lot of time just to switch back to global... wtf
I have played this game off and on for yearrrrs. It keeps drawing me back in with added features and other things. I started playing when it first came out!

Support is okay, balance patches could be better, the meta doesn't change as frequently as most would like to see. And certain units, even extremely rare ones, are useless left abandoned without buff for years. All that aside, still an incredibly addicting game. You can be relatively competitive as F2P. Not at the very top but in the top 5% of players is feasible.

Overall this game can be fun. You do not need to spend money unless you are trying to get the best monsters or trying to catch up competitively in the PVP scene. If you just want a mobile game to kill some time, there could be worse choices.
Great game, getting better by the years. Still heavy P2W but anyone can have some fun and enjoy a good time playing.

summoners war is a game that has stood the test of time, and for good reason. The sheer variety of monsters, strategic turn-based combat, and the thrill of building teams for different situations make it incredibly engaging. The PvP arena, guild battles, and raids offer a lot of depth and replay value, while the constant events and updates keep the game feeling fresh even after many years. The progression system is satisfying, and pulling a new monster you‚Äôve been waiting for always feels rewarding.

That being said, the game is not without flaws. The grind can be very intense, especially for new players who may find it overwhelming to catch up with veterans. Summoning rates for high-tier monsters are notoriously low, which can sometimes lead to frustration rather than excitement. Additionally, while the game is free-to-play friendly in some ways, it is undeniable that spending money can speed up progress significantly, which may discourage purely F2P players.

Overall, Summoners War is a fantastic strategy RPG with a dedicated community and years of content to explore. It‚Äôs a game that rewards patience and persistence, but it can also test both due to its heavy reliance on RNG and grind.
Always come back, pull zero nat5, uninstall the game‚Äîthen repeat.

First sentence of the review and i wish to impress the fact that i am trying to walk a line of neutrality here. It's a gacha game. There's not really much depth or story to engage with. i play mainly on the phone at work. Very tedious game. haven't found a better replacement for this with better tits yet. It's a harsher grind than a concrete plant. I've worked concrete and felt cleaner being coated in rock powder than playing this game. Really just a background thing to set and forget these days.

Real leery about these kinds of games. You always have to keep at the front of your mind that the game is waging psychological warfare against you with every menu press. im rank 55 and haven't spent a dime. i can play end game content only because I hoard all the freebies, events, and handouts like potions in skyrim. Never drank, always ready to use. I don't bother summoning anything but trash mobs as grist for the evolve mill anymore. events are the best ways to get better monsters. And there are plenty of those events throughout the year. The fusion system is easy enough to understand. It's a pyramid scheme. the best monsters on the fusion list require you to churn out thousands of low tier trash to upgrade the star ranks of the material monsters required for the fusions.

My point being, If you have time to waste, This is about as good as any. If you value your time more, try something else maybe. My thumbs up should be taken with a large grain of salt. The game certainly isn't for everyone. This one takes a lot of patience.
After 10 years, the development team has made this game more accessible to new players than ever before.

the most concistent gatcha free to play i've ever found he was there before it was a huge thing and it's actually hard but also have easy content, you actually have to strategise, make build of your own or copy other people but  even if you copy you gotta understand why...the game added manny tutorial to make the early game and give acces to the end game to any player very straight fforward just following the guide then you'll be a point where you can do anything well start preparing farming or looking for stuff you like, the premium currency is super generous honestly that game is so good mechanically that i wish we just had a game like this solo with a solo story and full blow rpg adventure tbh, it's very solid. Even with shitty monster you can make them strong find good team by surprise or accident et get attached to most monster.

I‚Äôve been playing Summoners War since 2018, and it‚Äôs honestly one of the few mobile games that‚Äôs kept me hooked for years. The monster designs, runes, and team-building strategies make every battle feel rewarding. I love how the game continues to grow with new content, events, and balance updates that keep it fresh. The only downside is the grind ‚Äî progressing and summoning rare monsters can take time and patience, especially for free players.

Rating: 8/10 ‚Äî A timeless, strategic RPG that rewards dedication and still delivers after all these years.

Play since high school kid around 2014 (potato phone). In that era this game was on TOP. Then lost the account due not bind or not connect any account (forgot). I spend a lot of time in this game farming and grinding until you can't sleep enough for fear of missing out on time (double exp or event). Never spend money on this game (F2P). Then I stop playing this game around 2020 something. Now I play again there are a lot changes on game mechanic itself such as save a lot time on grinding, it's easier to play than before plus more collab and fun events, easy to get Nat5 (5 Star Monster), last time my only 5 Star Monster are from Fusion only (No luck I guess). You can be better F2P player faster than last time.
Now I just chill and enjoy the game alone, chasing again the 2014 vibe when I was a kid play along with my friends, comparing every line up monster and rune combos we had plus some competitive on arena ranking. 

IGN : Feirisu.
Server : Asia

Pros: Nice casual game, has frequent updates, gives generous rewards, and the art team consistently does a great job with the characters and animations.
Cons: Gacha has no pity, violent runes are still broken.

Overall: Good game to come back to occasionally, no need to spend unless you want to get into its PVP competitively.

This game is super free-to-play friendly ‚Äî at least until you get into PVP. I‚Äôve been playing for about 4 months now and haven‚Äôt spent a single dollar. I‚Äôm 100% F2P, and honestly, the game has been great lately about giving out strong free units that can help you clear content and progress without spending.

I started playing seriously during the Tekken collab, and yeah, I‚Äôve gotten pretty lucky with my summons, but overall it‚Äôs a really fun and addictive game. The gameplay loop feels great, and they‚Äôve been improving the monster graphics a lot too ‚Äî I really like where the game‚Äôs heading.

I get why some people spend money, but I mostly play for the PVE side, not PVP. Over time, the game gives you some really solid 3- and 4-star monsters that can actually compete. Most players aren‚Äôt too tough, but once you start facing veterans who‚Äôve been around for years, it definitely gets harder ‚Äî which makes sense.

The devs are also adding a new PVP mode that‚Äôs supposed to help close the gap between new and long-time players, which sounds awesome. Overall, it‚Äôs a great game ‚Äî just don‚Äôt spend money you don‚Äôt have (even the content creator say that).

I first started playing this game in 2014 on google play. I don't think it's ever been a gacha in the sense that gachas are in the 2020s but the premium currency is definitely encouraged if you have no patience to play for longer than a week. 

If you want to progress, you're not actually going to be touching the phone for a while. It was like this in 2014, too, consistently. I have picked this game up now 4x since i started playing over 11 years ago and the grind to collects summoners/monsters/currencies/mats is the same as it was when i started. Regardless of what you think you're going to do in this game, you're primarily going to be running auto mode runs for sets and monsters/summoners. 

This is a mobile game. period. just because it is on the computer now does not mean it's changed. Expect early 2010s mobile game energy and you're going to be ecstatic with this game. Play this game expecting a pc game and youre going to be underwhelmed and annoyed. you can easily play this game and raise ranks without commiting 10k hours, but youre not going to raise ranks any time soon. sorry. it was like this in 2014 and it's like it now. 

You might even decide that you want to reset your account progress a time or two because you realize how much time is going to take to regather the buff set you just placed on your garbo summoner instead of saving it for a rare drop you get in two months. this game will punish you -easily- for not saving your stuff. 

its fun. buy it. dont buy it. it's a mobile game; if you go into the game thinking it's anything but then you're gonna waste time playing. it doesn't change. the first 5 minutes of your game time is 100% of the experience you will have. run the dungeon, run against a person using the exact same mechanics, buff your team, switch out your team. 


idk what else to say other than it hasn't drastically changed in the last 10+ years and i don't think it ever will.

I have played this game since the start, back in 2014. I can still remember my first 5* (Ariel). This game has come a long way and is by far one of the best games I have ever played (4000+ days on this game). Com2us (the creator's) always have new events, content and even new monsters every month. The premium crystals are actually obtainable through these events, so you don't have to pay to win. This game does require patience and time. I love the auto battle features the best, so can start a battle and do something else in the mean time.

a very good game, if your into summoning monsters type a games then your gonna love this there is so much to do the designs are awesome and the crossovers insane like they got the witcher and demon slayer . i  would highly recommend trying this game out at least once{its very addicting).

Now that it's on Steam, I can just play other games and just tabing this game and do afk farm on the dungeon. Currently, there are a lot of events where you can easily level up your monsters to the max level. Overall, it's fun! 24/30

It's clear that they're pushing for the game to be more of an eSport, but there's a huge issue. All matches come down to 2 factors: the people who either sink tens of thousands of dollars into the game or have been playing non-stop for a decade who are impossible to catch up to, and the RNG spam from vio runes, which immediately flip entire winnable battles into automatic losses. There is no strategy involved. It's all down to hoping your vio runes proc more than the enemies vio runes. It's ridiculous.

Oh perfect it's my time to comment. So I've probably spent over maybe $4,000 in the entirety of owning this game. Possibly more. There's no excuse it just kind of sucks you in and before you realize it ridiculious prices start to not look so bad and look like good deals. That's why it's called GACHA. It's really gambling in a sense. Anyway, I've definitely spent in the ballpark o $4,000 to maybe $7,000 max and one day they had this weird easy to do option to reset your account. But that button was placed near another button and I pressed it one day by accident. So I emailed them multiple itmes and thye just kept sayin they can't help. Over the years time and time again I see an ad and remember my account and some nice characters I had but when I emailed them they say too much time had passed. 

Your time energy and money is all useless here. It will always be for nothing. These people do not care about your account. And you will spend UNGODLY amount of time trying to get into this game. it's insane how many hours you can sink but it's definitely not healthy or productive. It's like the gamers version of gambling now that I think about it. Go play a game from a company that cares about you. Also, it is very likely you'll lhit a wall for much of the content unless you devote 10+ years of your life to still be incredibly behind and not at all competitive with p2w players. Your time energy AND money is NOT valued here at all.

A casino dressed cute, built purely on your gambling instincts.

‚ñ† The storyline is short and generic, immediately introducing you to THE GRIND. Leaves you want more.
‚ñ† The atmosphere feels like a liquid ADHD fever dream after an energy drink.
‚ñ† The community is toxic, aggressive, gatekeeping, and other ways unpleasant.
‚ñ† Even if I were to look past that, I had TWO separate Com2Us accounts mysteriously deleted after a hiatus (it doesn't matter if you play on Steam or on phone). Any and every sign-up method and 'account safety measure' proved useless and I'm not alone.
‚ñ† The company disrespects its users every turn. Met many people who blew a lot of cash on it without getting any notable reward.

It's not worth it. Don't get tempted.

It's clear that they're pushing for the game to be more of an eSport, but there's a huge issue. All matches come down to 2 factors: the people who either sink tens of thousands of dollars into the game or have been playing non-stop for a decade who are impossible to catch up to, and the RNG spam from vio runes, which immediately flip entire winnable battles into automatic losses. There is no strategy involved. It's all down to hoping your vio runes proc more than the enemies vio runes. It's ridiculous.

Oh perfect it's my time to comment. So I've probably spent over maybe $4,000 in the entirety of owning this game. Possibly more. There's no excuse it just kind of sucks you in and before you realize it ridiculious prices start to not look so bad and look like good deals. That's why it's called GACHA. It's really gambling in a sense. Anyway, I've definitely spent in the ballpark o $4,000 to maybe $7,000 max and one day they had this weird easy to do option to reset your account. But that button was placed near another button and I pressed it one day by accident. So I emailed them multiple itmes and thye just kept sayin they can't help. Over the years time and time again I see an ad and remember my account and some nice characters I had but when I emailed them they say too much time had passed. 

Your time energy and money is all useless here. It will always be for nothing. These people do not care about your account. And you will spend UNGODLY amount of time trying to get into this game. it's insane how many hours you can sink but it's definitely not healthy or productive. It's like the gamers version of gambling now that I think about it. Go play a game from a company that cares about you. Also, it is very likely you'll lhit a wall for much of the content unless you devote 10+ years of your life to still be incredibly behind and not at all competitive with p2w players. Your time energy AND money is NOT valued here at all.

A casino dressed cute, built purely on your gambling instincts.

‚ñ† The storyline is short and generic, immediately introducing you to THE GRIND. Leaves you want more.
‚ñ† The atmosphere feels like a liquid ADHD fever dream after an energy drink.

‚ñ† Even if I were to look past that, I had TWO separate Com2Us accounts mysteriously deleted after a hiatus (it doesn't matter if you play on Steam or on phone). Any and every sign-up method and 'account safety measure' proved useless and I'm not alone.
‚ñ† The company disrespects its users every turn. Met many people who blew a lot of cash on it without getting any notable reward.

It's not worth it. Don't get tempted.
